reviews.text: A friend and I were traveling out of Santa Fe for a week and leaving early so we came down to the airport the night before, stayed at the Hyatt 1 nite and left the car for 8 days for free.
reviews.title: Great Value and Can Leave Car FREE

likes.liked: — Great Value and service for the price, excellent for airport traveling in or out of Albuquerque

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only was it beautiful, clean, and a perfect professional staff but the continental breakfast that was included would have cost 10.00 each here in Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Hello, Housekeeping? We Have a Problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a former Conceriege in SF and have called fellow professionals to sugest this property for guests needing a quick fix at the airport.
reviews.title: Amazing stay. Totally unexpected luxury.

likes.disliked: — Fussy location, but good for airport departure.

reviews.text: Also when we got back one quick call to the hotel and the free shuttle was there in 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - great design -space in rooms

likes.disliked: — Distance to town / strange road lay-out

reviews.text: Can not suggest this hotel enough.
reviews.title: Hip and comfortable

reviews.text: The Hyatt Place was ah excellent hotel for our family. Immaculate rooms, wide, flat screen TV, free internet, great breakfast. Our only compaint was the poor service and incredibly unfriendly staff. They provide no information at check in, or in the room for breakfast times, local activities, pool hours, etc. All is to be garnered from the in house service menu on your room TV, but not accurate info there. They shut breakfast down early---whenever they feel like it-----and no warning. No vending machines in house at all. I(f you want a soda, candy bar, or chips you buy it at the front desk
reviews.title: Great place----lousy service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "gallery area" for a hugely inflated price. The HYatt Place was a great spot to rest on a road trip, but not here again, thanks to the staff. No way to win customers, folks! Work a little on public relations!
reviews.title: Nice place with minor inconveniences

reviews.text: We stayed twice in May, about 10 days apart. Each time we had a large, clean room with good beds, quiet air conditioner, separate sitting area, huge flat screen TV, and good breakfast. The first night we were on the sixth floor, and discovered one elevator only went to the fifth floor. The second stay we discovered one of two elevators was not working at all, and we were on the fifth floor. OK, so they're elevator challenged, but that's minor for those who can use stairs. Other than that, I'd say the location is a bit difficult to find at first, but we'd stay again.
reviews.title: Beware! Do not stay if you have a choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself looks to be a clean and well kept place to reside for your stay. However, I was placed into a dirty unkempt room under construction and given some of the worst service here of any of my business hotel stays. I travel weekly across the US and stayed here as it seemed to be close to the airport and a visually pleasing hotel. I was not treated very nicely at all by the staff at the hotel and when confronting the front desk or any staff with an issue, I was told that it was out of their control or not an issue at all. There was no attempt at all to accommodate me or to remedy the issues that I had with the room or the services. I was blatantly lied to about the hotel policy and was wrongly advised about state law in their hotel. They have a minuscule bar with little to no service and they will inform you after having three beers that you are not allowed by law and by hotel policy to have anymore (which is neither Hyatt policy or New Mexico State law). Please do not stay here if you have any ability to stay at another facility.
reviews.title: 100% As Advertised

reviews.text: Clean, modern hotel by the airport, everything as advertised, a great option if you have to sleep near the airport.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice hotel by the airport

reviews.text: The Hyatt Place ABQ airport is a really nice place - the rooms are pretty huge and they have a nice little living room area with an l-shaped couch and HUGE flatscreen TV and a computer desk. There is also a tiny fridge in the room. The bed was nice and comfy but the bathroom is really small and outdated, but certainly comfy and good for business travel. One odd thing is the fact that they do not have vending machines so you are forced to buy all items (water, soda, etc) at the front desk and it is pricey but really convenient. They have all kinds of snacks, etc. that are available 24/7. I would suggest going to a gas station or something and getting H20 for your room!
reviews.title: Pretty good stay at the Hyatt Place ABQ Airport!

likes.liked: — Rooms are spacious, comfortable, quiet and attractive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I arrived, there was (and I am not joking) a small amount of blood on the shower curtain. The housekeeping staff did come up right away and removed it and offered to move me to another room - but it was still GROSS. They told me the manager would call and discuss this matter with me and no one called - I have been home since Friday and they still have not called. I think a manager should call on an issue like that, but hey, overall the stay was nice and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great little place to stay

likes.liked: — The smell of the lobby and the size of the room
likes.disliked: — The doors slamming early in the morning

reviews.text: We spend winters in southern NM and make regular trips to Albuquerque. We've tried a number of other hotels and given the economy, looked for a "better" deal this month without success. This hotel is attractive, the rooms are comfortable and spacious, and the staff is friendly.
reviews.title: Best Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm impressed with Hyatt's new concept, Hyatt Place. It feels like a boutique hotel when you walk in.
reviews.title: Fantastic Accomodations

reviews.text: On two consecutive days we had our room uncleaned by hotel staff. (Our entire trip was 5 days ) When we returned home after an afternoon of activity (4:00 pm) we asked if our room could be "refreshed", we were told that "there was nothing we could do about it". The next day we were given the same answer when our room when "unrefreshed".
reviews.title: poor experience for family

reviews.text: Our bill did not reflect the dates that we stayed at the hotel or the charges that were incurred while we were at the hotel.
reviews.title: great rooms but breakfast falls down relative to peers
